1.title: Bianca Mikahn and Jason Keyes
1.plot: Bianca Mikahn takes us on a musical and ethereal journey that defies genre and inspires completely. Comedian Jason Keyes adds a little southern charm and a lot of laughter. Hosted by Bree Davies.

2.title: Ryan Chrys and the Rough Cuts
2.plot: Ryan Chrys and The Rough Cuts brings forth new energy to country music fans who love the heroes and outlaws of old, They drive their sound with blazing guitars, gritty lap steel and a rock n roll attitude known as "Modern Outlaw Country". Broadcast television premiere for their video "Country Music Soundtrack". Hosted by Bree Davies.

3.title: 2MX2 Featuring Lolita Castañeda
3.plot: 2MX2 is an bilingual Hip Hop duo out of Colorado. They are well known for their modern renditions of traditional Latin music as well as their focus on political topics such as immigration, health, education reform, and other important matters of our time. Lolita Castañeda i an artist, activist, and advocate for the arts. Short: "Welcome to the Northside: Palm Pies." Hosted by Bree Davies.

4.title: Whole Milk and Rick Bryan
4.plot: Whole Milk is a beach goth/shoe gaze band based in Denver, Colorado. Following in The Astronauts footsteps, Whole Milk is bringing waves to the Mile High scene. Rick Bryan is a stand-up comedian from Denver, CO. Rick loves performing for an audience, enjoys being happy and is happy when making others laugh. Hosted by Bree Davies.

5.title: Erica Brown and the Movers and Shakers with Mo Vida
5.plot: Kick off your shoes and dance away the blues with the legendary Erica Brown as she is joined by the soulful sounds of The Movers and Shakers. The bewitching Comedian Mo Vida gets us laughing. Hosted by the lovely Gabrielle Bryant.

6.title: Judge Roughneck & Kyle Pogue
6.plot: The Legendary Judge Roughneck performs!. Their blend of ska and reggae pays tribute to both the early '80's British 2-Tone movement and the original jazz-laced ska of Jamaica, infused with soul,and has been electrifying audiences since 1995. Kyle Pogue is a stand up comedian, actor, writer and show producer. He is one third of the comedy group, Fort Comedy, which produces shows all over Colorado.

7.title: Emma Mayes & The Hip & D. Kelley
7.plot: Emma Mayes and The Hip, The Hip standing for "Highly Important People", is a conglomerate of Denver musicians that bring together an interesting fusion mixed with lush vocal harmonies, catchy horns, and danceable melodies. D Kelley has been performing comedy for more than 10 years. Mixing a variety of material pulled from everyday life, storytelling and impromptu audience interactions.

8.title: Twin Flame Medicine & Jeff Koen
8.plot: Twin Flame Medicine is a force of soul, groove, and good vibration. Lead singer and baritone ukulele player, Monalicious, keeps it real with her raw lyrics and chill captivating vocals. Bass player, Swirl, holds down the groove and weaves intricate melodies on his 5-string bass and Drummer, Galaxy Bill, is a groove master with deep pockets. Artist and funny man Jeff Koen joins us as well.

9.title: Dressy Bessy and Terri Barton Gregg
9.plot: 100th Episode Celebration with DRESSY BESSY. Denver darlings Dressy Bessy join us for a dance party and the "Hebrew Hairdresser" herself, Terri Barton Gregg supplies the laughs. Hosted by warrior woman Bree Davies.

10.title: Married a Dead Man and Chuck Roy
10.plot: Married a Dead Man weaves together disparate influences and creates an eclectic mix of goth, shoegaze and dark-wave, culminating in a unique Denver-based sound. Joined by comedy legend Chuck Roy. Hosted by Bree Davies.

11.title: Voz de la Clave & Nora Lynch
11.plot: Voz de la Clave is CU Denver's premier Latin Jazz ensemble. A versatile group, Voz performs various styles of music from Salsa to Contemporary Jazz. Joined by comedy powerhouse and legend Nora Lynch. Hosted by Bree Davies.

12.title: SoloHawk & Stephanie McHugh
12.plot: SoloHawk is an Indie-Folk situation. The duo comes together from other prominent projects and features Steve "Faceman" and Til Willis. Joined by comedy rock star Stephanie McHugh. Hosted by Bree Davies.

13.title: Music Video Special: Part Two
13.plot: The Sounds on 29th music video madness continues. Featuring: Pink Hawks, Teacup Gorilla, Natalie Tate, Strange Americans, Blanket Empire and Holophrase. Hosted by Denver Diva Bree Davies.

15.title: Music Video Special: Part Three
15.plot: The final installment of the Sounds on 29th music video specials features: Chimney Choir, Natalie Tate, Safe Boating is No Accident, Bolonium and Strange Americans. Hosted by music video maven, Bree Davies.

1.title: Safe Boating Is No Accident/Danielle Ate the Sandwich
1.plot: Out of Order and Brass Tree Sessions present SOUNDS ON 29TH, a performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts. It was taped at the Channel 12 KBDI studios on 29th and Welton, featuring Fairchildren and Nathaniel Rateliff.

2.title: Fairchildren/Nathaniel Rateliff
2.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

3.title: The Pirate Signal
3.plot: Known for their highly energetic live performances, The Pirate Signal creates a sound that mixes rap, hip hop and alternative rock. The band performs live at the Channel 12 Studios on 29th and Welton.

4.title: Snake Rattle Rattle Snake
4.plot: Sounds on 29th presents Snake Rattle Rattle Snake - a band that creates music steeped in the darkness, perpetually dodging the sunny sheen of pop tendencies in favor of the shadows.

5.title: Shel
5.plot: Comprised of four sisters this local folk band plays "hauntingly beautiful songs, rich with complex harmonies and melodies and displaying stunning riffs on mandolins, violins, drums and other instruments" (Scene Magazine). Sounds on 29th is a performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts.

6.title: Sauna
6.plot: Sauna is made up of four local teens, Molly Bartlett, Samantha Davis, Ethan Hill and CJ Macleod, and is "an intelligent pop band that crams jumpy beats and reverb-heavy guitars into a perfect throwback package" (Westword). Sounds on 29th a performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts.

7.title: The Samples
7.plot: 25 years after starting his full-fledged music career with The Samples, Sean Kelly continues to delight fans with music that transcends genres, age and shatters the rules of the established music industry. This episode captures Sean and the band as they perform live in the CPT12 studios at 29th and Welton.

8.title: Eye & the Arrow with Patrick Dethlefs
8.plot: Eye & the Arrow and Patrick Dethlefs (who put out a split album last year) perform live in the CPT12 studios. Now only in his early 20s, local folk musician Patrick Dethlefs won the Best Teen Songwriter Award (2009) at Swallow Hill Music. Eye & the Arrow is comprised of Paul Dehaven (guitar), Jason Hass-Hecker (bass) and Mark Anderson (drums)

9.title: Fingers of the Sun
9.plot: Led by Suzi Allegra and Nathan Brasil, Fingers of the Sun describe themselves as "post-apathetic psych pop." In this episode, the band performs a sampling of their music which is made up of "sci-fi pulp novels, lazy teenage afternoons and a vividly realized wonderland of imagery, psychedelia and mid 20th century pop."

10.title: Ian Cooke
10.plot: With a style that draws from classical music, pop, folk, avant-garde, world music, and jazz, Ian Cooke makes art for your ears using his cello and voice. A local favorite, he was voted the top musician in the 2009 Denver Post Underground Music Poll. This episode captures Cooke as he performs live in the CPT12 studios.

11.title: Chella Negro
11.plot: Out of Order and Brass Tree Sessions are proud to announce their joint production Sounds on 29th. A performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts. Taped at the Channel 12 Studios on 29th and Welton. This episode feature Chella Negro & The Charm.

12.title: Go Star
12.plot: This episode features music by Go Star. Out of Order and Brass Tree Sessions are proud to announce their joint production Sounds on 29th. A performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts.

13.title: Hindershot
13.plot: Local band Hindershot was founded on a simple premise: music, however challenging, should always be a good time. Despite poetic lyrics, unusual chord changes, complex harmonies, and an eclectic list of influences (Beck, T. Rex, David Bowie, The Beach Boys, The Pixies), Hindershot boasts a repertoire of post-whatever jams you can dance to.

14.title: Hearts in Space
14.plot: This psychedelic garage rock group from Denver includes Ezra Darnell on vocals, guitar and bass. Jordan Hubner on vocals and guitar, Johnny Lundock on drums, Zale Hassler (KEYS/ VOX) and Ryan Slowkowski on bass and guitar. This special captures the energetic group as they perform live at the CPT12 studios at 29th & Welton.

15.title: The Knew
15.plot: With a sound described as "primal, tight and devouring," this Denver-based band is chuck-full of howling vocals, guitar buffets and celebratory drum pounding. Their latest full-length album, Man Monster, is a body slam of melody, power, and thick riffs. In this episode, the rock quartet performs live at the CPT12 studios.

16.title: Skeleton Show
16.plot: Self-described as "2 guitars, 1 bass, 1 drummer, laying in a pocket of space, like a bag of bones" this episode of Sounds on 29th features local band Skeleton Show, performing in the CPT12 studios on 29th & Welton.

17.title: Bonnie & the Beard
17.plot: A performance by local Colorado band, Bonnie & The Beard, in the CPT12 studios off 29th & Welton.

18.title: Chimney Choir
18.plot: This episode of Sounds on 29th features local group Chimney Choir as they perform in the CPT12 studios off 29th & Welton.

19.title: Best of 2012 Part 1 of 2
19.plot: A performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts. Performers include Bonnie and the Beard, Pirate Signal, Nathaniel Rateliff, Hindershot, The Knew, Hearts in Space, Snake Rattle Rattle Snake, Eye and the Arrow, Patrick Dethlefs , SHEL, Danielle Ate the Sandwich, Chella Negro, Ian Cooke, and Chimney Choir.

20.title: Best of 2012 Part 2 of 2
20.plot: A performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts. Performers include Bonnie and the Beard, Pirate Signal, Nathaniel Rateliff, Hindershot, The Knew, Hearts in Space, Snake Rattle Rattle Snake, Eye and the Arrow, Patrick Dethlefs , SHEL, Danielle Ate the Sandwich, Chella Negro, Ian Cooke, and Chimney Choir.

1.title: Heather Snow & Faceman
1.plot: FaceMan believes that life is the party. Made up of Steve (aka FaceMan) on vocals and guitar, David Thomas Bailey on 7-string guitar, and Dean Hirschfield on drums, the Denver rock trio is known for their ambitious live performances and overall collaborative approach. Hosted by Sid Pink, this episode also features comedian Heather Snow.

2.title: Christie Buchele & the Yawpers
2.plot: Hosted by Sid Pink, this episode features comedian Christie Buchele and emerging Boulder quartet The Yawpers. Led by dynamic young singer-songwriter Nate Cook and guitarist Jesse Parmet, The Yawpers recall a grittier version of Wilco, with as much raw country sensibility as twisted indie imagination.

3.title: Chris Charpenter & the Raven & the Writing Desk
3.plot: Featuring ethereal lead singer Julia LiBassi (pictured), Raven and the Writing Desk is a six-piece group that is "always pushing the boundaries of creativity, they combine elements of classical, pop and rock into their overall sound" (Examiner.com). Hosted by Sid Pink, this episode also features comedian Chris Charpentier.

4.title: Nathan Lund & Wheelchair Sports Camp
4.plot: Hosted by Sid Pink, this episode features comedian Nathan Lund and Wheelchair Sports Camp, the Denver-based pseudo hip-hop band fronted by wheelchair bound MC/producer Kalyn. The band is a combination of live and electronic instruments with a more live, jazzy, funky, combination to the traditional hip-hop group.

5.title: Kristin Rand & Sara Belle and Friends
5.plot: Denver artist Sara Belle loves fuzz pedals, bright pop harmonies, one-note guitar solos, and 60's girl groups. In this performance, Sara Belle invites accordion player Dylan Lenz (Blind Man Deaf Boy), bass player Dave Reeves (The Maybellines) and drummer Ryan Heller (Lawsuit Models) to play a selection of her favorite 60s-inspired French classics. Hosted by Sid Pink with special guest Kristin Rand

6.title: Elliot Woolsey & the Outfit
6.plot: Sid Pink hosts this episode featuring Denver-based comedian Elliot Woolsey and The Outfit - a four-piece indie rock band that offers an earnest take on garage rock revival, championing straightforward, back-to-basics pop songwriting with unapologetic sincerity. Their guitars chime and hum with undiscerning admiration toward both new and old schools of rock.

7.title: Nathaniel Rateliff & the Night Sweats
7.plot: Nathaniel Rateliff and the Night Sweats make their TV debut with a set of pure soul magic! In this new endeavor, Denver folk-rocker Rateliff's "traditionally gentle and alluring vocals morph into that of a bellowing soul god" (We Heart Music) as he performs with The Night Sweats, a seven-piece soul outfit that includes drums, keys, bass, guitar and horns.

8.title: Sam Tallent & Denver City Saltlicks
8.plot: Sid Pink hosts this episode featuring Denver-based comedian Timmi Lasley and Little Fyodor - an artist who has been spreading his unique brand of avant-pop madness throughout the world musical underground for over twenty years, creating twisted, satirical songs which - beneath a crass and maniacal outer shell - express a deep empathy with those who most acutely experience the frustrations ...

9.title: Mara Wiles & Shady Elders
9.plot: Hosted by Sid Pink, this show features comedian Mara Wiles and dream-pop music by Shady Elders.

10.title: Aaron Urist & Dan Treanor Afrosippi Band with Erica Brown
10.plot: Hosted by Sid Pink, this show features comedian Aaron Urist and music by Dan Treanor's Afrosippi Band featuring Erica Brown.

11.title: Swing Je Taime & Bradley Galli
11.plot: Inspired by a passion for the Gypsy/Manouche traditions of Django Reinhardt, Swing Je T'aime's gypsy jazz has "French undertones and a Brazilian beat that give the music an exotic flare" (Loveland Reporter Herald). Hosted by Sid Pink, this episode also features Denver comedian Bradley Galli.

12.title: Little Fyodor & Babushka with Timmi Lasley
12.plot: Sid Pink hosts this episode featuring Denver-based comedian Timmi Lasley and Little Fyodor - an artist who has been spreading his unique brand of avant-pop madness throughout the world musical underground for over twenty years, creating twisted, satirical songs which - beneath a crass and maniacal outer shell - express a deep empathy with those who most acutely experience the frustrations and ...

13.title: Jen Korte and the Loss featuring Moxie
13.plot: Known for her powerful vocal delivery and charismatic performances, Jen Korte, front woman for Jen Korte and The Loss, delivers her acoustic, indie soul stylings in this cool studio session. Hosted by Sid Pink, the show also features Mara Wiles and fellow comedian Kristin Rand, who have teamed up to form the new sketch comedy group, Moxie.

14.title: Dustin Bones and the Body Stealers Featuring Jordan Dell
14.plot: Dustin Bones is described as "Surf music meets a Quentin Tarantino horror flick (Horror Surf). This episode is hosted by the illustrious Sid Pink and features Jordan Doll the 2013 Comedy Works New Faces Competition.

15.title: Rachael Pollard/Nate Marcy and Zach Maas
15.plot: In this episode, singer-songwriter Rachael Pollard and drummer Nate Marcy create magic. "Complex, spacious and chiming with a ghostly air, Pollard's music is everything that one could ask from a musician. Her songs are honest, complicated, poignant, and even funny" (Syntax). Hosted by Sid Pink, the show also features comedian Zach Maas.

16.title: Rubedo and Kevin O'Brien
16.plot: Rubedo is the alchemy of rock and roll. In this studio session, the Denver-based band (Kyle Gray, Alex Trujillo and Gregg Ziemba) performs music that communicates positive mantras overlaying an organic sound of psychedelia, roots, and rock with tasty sprinkles of hip-hop and soul. The special also features local wiseacre Kevin O'Brien.

17.title: Ark Life and Eric Henderson
17.plot: Hosted by Sid Pink, this episode showcases Ark Life, a Denver-based band formed by Jesse Elliott that "blends together a crew of good musicians to make some fine open-air/open-highway music, all tied up with three-part female harmonies" (Heather Browne). Up-and-coming comic Eric Henderson rounds out the show with his high energy observations.

18.title: Dragon Deer & John Crist
18.plot: The bluesy psychedelia group Dragondeer includes frontman Eric Halborg and Drummer Carl Sorensen of Swayback as well as Cole Rudy of Varlet on mandolin and lap steel. According to Westword, "Halborg and company delve into some swampy blues and reverb-drenched psych folk." This week they perform their cosmic blues in the CPT12 studio in addition to imaginative comedy by John Crist.

19.title: Best of Music
19.plot: A performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts including Dan Treanor's Afrosippi Band & Erica Brown, Ark Life, Rubedo, Faceman, Little Fyodor & Babushka, The Yawpers, Sara Belle, Wheelchair Sports Camp, The Outfit, Jen Korte & the Loss, Denver City Saltlicks, Dustin Bones & the Body Stealers, Raven & the Writing Desk, Dragon Deer, Rachael Pollard and Nathaniel Rateliff & the Night Sweats

20.title: Best of Comedy 2013
20.plot: A performance showcase of some of Colorado's finest acts featuring local comedians Jordan Doll, Mara Wiles, Chris Charpentier, Kevin O'Brien, Kristin Rand, Aaron Urist, Timmi Lasley, Elliot Woolsey, Bradley Galli, Sam Tallent, Christie Buchele, Nathan Lund, Heather Snow, John Crist, Eric Henderson, Zach Maas and Moxie.

1.title: Indigenous Robot & Haley Driscoll
1.plot: Indigenous Robot brings their Psych Garage Rock sound to the Sounds on 29th studios along with the comedic stylings of Haley Driscoll. Hosted by Theresa Mercado.

2.title: Casey James Prestwood & The Burning Angels & Harley Driscoll
2.plot: Local honky-tonk musicians Casey James Prestwood & The Burning Angels and Comedian Haley Driscoll perform. Hosted by Theresa Mercado.

3.title: The Highland Gypsies & Matt Wayman
3.plot: This program showcases the Highland Gypsies, a Spanish Flamenco music and dance group based in Denver. The group brings together musicians from many world cultures and infuses their playing with Flamenco guitar and dance. Local comedian Matt Wayman also performs.

4.title: Ancient Elk & Matt Monroe
4.plot: This episode features Ancient Elk, who describe their music as "psychedelic, garage rock, operatic, yodeling, only partly kidding;" as well as Matt Monroe, who names himself "Systems Engineer by day, Comedian by night. It's a lot like the Bruce Wayne/Batman dichotomy but without all the pesky money, good looks, capes, women, fighting, gadgets, abs, butlers, and property ownership."

5.title: Faceman & Professor Phelyx
5.plot: Local Denver favorites Faceman perform in a life-sized shoebox diorama stage and Professor Phelyx performs slight of hand.

6.title: Jesse Manley & Derrik Rush
6.plot: Jesse Manley & Emily Rose Lewis fill the studio with sonic and sweetness and Derrick Rush exercises our funny bones!

7.title: The Fabulous Boogienauts & Adrain Mesa
7.plot: This week, The Fabulous Boogienauts - a ten piece all-original power disco funk ensemble - take the stage for a high-energy, theatrical show. On the comedy front, 1st generation Cuban-American comedian Adrian P. Mesa turns in an inspired comedy performance.

8.title: Dangerous Nonsense & James Draper
8.plot: Always over the top, Dangerous Nonsense's sets can include all new music, costume changes, choreography, performance art, whistles, water boarding, flute noodling and side acts. This week, the all-girl trio performs its post-punk art metal music alongside comedian James Draper.

9.title: Covenhoven & Jeff Albright
9.plot: This week, Covenhoven, the symphonic folk ensemble lead by Joel Van Horne and comedian Jeff Albright perform in the Sounds on 29th Studios.

10.title: Calder's Revolvers & Roger Norquist
10.plot: This week, Calder's Revolvers, a modern soul group with heavy backbeats, pulsing guitar riffs and heart-wrenching vocals perform along with comedian Roger Norquist in the Sounds on 29th Studios.

12.title: Andy Hamilton & the Whiskey Hitchers & Ken Arkind
12.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

13.title: Charly Fasano fet Malmadre & Timmi Lasley
13.plot: On this episode: Charly Fasano is a multimedia artist and poet from Denver. He combines poetry, block printing, spoken word and film to present a rich storytelling experience. Malamadre brings together a diverse vision of artistic experience and influences. Joined by the fabulous comedian Timmi Lasley.

14.title: Adam Lopez & His Rhythm Review & Christie Buchele
14.plot: On this episode: Adam Lopez & His Rhythm Review Covering all forms of Outlaw Rockabilly, Rock & Roll, Rhythm & Blues, Honky Tonk, Western and more!Christie Buchele is an up-and-coming standup comic from the Mile-High city, crushing audiences with a wry, biting style that's a bit surly and really, really funny.

15.title: In the Whale & Paulie Lipman
15.plot: On this episode: In the Whale is dirty and aggressive, yet surprisingly light-hearted. With an undeniable live show and a tenacious work ethic, this Denver band won't be local for long. Paulie Lipman has been a part of 8 Denver National Slam Teams. In addition to Spoken Word, Paulie is also a musician/composer.

16.title: Atlas
16.plot: Sounds on 29th showcases some of Colorado's finest talent. Altas has written some of the most interesting and evocative rock music to come out of Denver. At the core of the band is a group of friends that came together as a result of coincidence and a shared Mexican heritage. Juan Carlos Flores, Israel Jimenez and Enrique Jimenez.

17.title: Best of Music 2014
17.plot: Sounds on 29th, a performance showcase featuring Colorado's finest acts, looks back at some of the magical moments captured in 2014. Featuring Casey James Prestwood and the Burning Angels, CovenHoven, In The Whale, FaceMan, Dangerous Nonsense and many more.

18.title: Best of Comedy, Spoken Work, and More 2014
18.plot: Join us as we take a look back at some of the funniest and wittiest moments captured in our studio in 2014. Featuring Christie Buchele, Ken Arkind, Adrian P. Mesa, Haley Driscoll, Professor Phelyx, Matt Wayman, Paulie Lipman, Timmi Lasley, Derrick Rush, Matt Monroe, Jeff M. Albright, James Drape, Hippie Man and Roger Norquist .

1.title: Cop Circles & Ian Douglas Terry
1.plot: Cop Circles was created by Luke Leavitt. Drawing on styles diverse as Bossa Nova, No Wave, and Deep House, Cop Circles is nonetheless unified by unfettered funky emotions. Joined by incredibly hilarious comedian Ian Douglas Terry!.

2.title: Pizza Time & Bianca Mikahn
2.plot: Pizza Time delivers timeless garage pop. Headed up by frontman David Castillo, Burger Records fan favorite turns the studio into a dance party. We are also joined by the formidable and talented Bianca Mikahn for some spoken word enlightenment.

3.title: Erika Ryann & Sneaky Bones and Janea Burris
3.plot: Erika Ryann pulls her sound from dark honky tonks, small western towns, and years lived in the tangled woods of southern Colorado. Comedian Janae Burris, is a seven year veteran of stand-up comedy and recent Denver transplant.

4.title: Land Lines & Zach Reinert
4.plot: Land Lines is an impossible decade, some gap in history where the tines of early electric pianos shimmer in echo chambers, baroque cellos thrum minor chords, and modern percussive rhythms build with surgical precision, all culminating in sparing, angular pop melodies that find new creative spaces in an otherwise overpopulated musical landscape. Joined by talented comedian Zach Reinert.

5.title: Chemistry Club & Cory Helie
5.plot: Chemistry Club is a Colorado-native sci-fi/electropop band with work including music, video games, and comics. Formed in 2012, the band has worked to bring pop music and nerd culture together in a blend of synthesizers, guitar, and SCIENCE. Comedian Cory Helie is the host of the popular podcast '"Welcome to Denver (The Low Down on the Mile High") and Mutiny Information Cafe open mic comedy show.

6.title: New Ben Franklins and Penn Darfield
6.plot: The New Ben Franklins, are well known for their live shows. Call it noisy country, Americana, alternative country - It doesn't matter to them, as long as it's loud and fun. Joined by PBS phone bank volunteer turned comedian, Penn Darfield.

7.title: Space Suits for Indians and Mitch Jones
7.plot: Space Suits for Indians with Mitch Jones, Hosted by Magic Cyclops.

8.title: I Sank Molly Brown with Sam Tallent
8.plot: I Sank Molly Brown has a crisp, clean flavor; suggestive, yet unassuming, mild and yet untamed.Sam Tallent's from Denver. Sam has been described as 'the Black Flag of comedy. His home club is the Denver Comedy Works and Too Much Fun.

9.title: Driftin' Suns & Jeff Albright
9.plot: Musical guests the Driftin' Suns takes the stage as comedian Jeff Albright returns for more laughs.

10.title: The Patti Fiasco and Carey Denise
10.plot: A Jet-fueled powerhouse fronted by Alysia Kraft, The Patti Fiasco rides the edge of emotional extremes, delivering a brash yet fiercely soulful brand of rock and roll. Joined by comedian Carey Denise. Hosted by Bree Davies.

11.title: Emma Mayes & Abby Alt
11.plot: Beautiful, bright, and catchy; just a few words that come to mind when speaking of Emma Mayes. She has a powerful and soulful voice in a class all her own. Joined by the incredibly funny and stylish Abby Alt.

12.title: Gata Negra and Hakeem Furious
12.plot: Gata Negra is a Denver based rock trio featuring Whitney Rehr, Nick Fiore and Michele Crook. Hakeem Furious travels the country as a poet and musician with Capital 6 brethren, Black on Black Rhyme poetry troupe and the Denver Mercury Cafe slam team.

13.title: Kid Astronaut and Meaghan Shaha
13.plot: The incredibly talented Jon Shockness joins us as Kid Astronaut for a powerful set of soulful music. Comedian Meaghan Shaha stops by to slay the audience and take names. Hosted by Gabrielle Bryant.

14.title: Edison and Brent Podosek
14.plot: Edison joins us fresh off a national tour in support of their self-released debut EP, Ghosts. Every one's favorite funny man Brent Podosek stops by as well. Hosted by Gabrielle Bryant.

15.title: Plume Varia & Eric Henderson
15.plot: Plume Varia is the dream/indie-pop project of husband and wife, Shon and Cherie Cobbs. Join us as they put us in a state of sonic reverie. Comedian Eric Henderson returns to the show to catch us up on what he has been up to. Hosted by Bree Davies.

16.title: Church Fire & Bethany Hernandez
16.plot: Church Fire sets the studio ablaze with an electrifying performance like no other. Comedian Bethany Hernandez adds some sizzle of her own. Hosted by Bree Davies.

17.title: 2015 Best Moments on Music
17.plot: This program showcases the greatest musical moments from 2015.

18.title: 2015 Best of Comedy and Spoken Word
18.plot: This show features the year's most hilarious moments as well as some inspiring spoken word.

1.title: Mono Verde Collective & Vicki Edgar
1.plot: Sway to the sounds of the The Mono Verde Collective, bringing Latin reggae rhythms to the Mile High. Comedian Vicki Edgar shares some hilarious marital advice.

2.title: A Shoreline Dream & Stacy Roquemore
2.plot: The critically acclaimed, A Shoreline Dream builds a beautiful wall of sound in a very special acoustic performance and Comedian Stacy Roquemore, rocks the house.

3.title: Erin Palmer & Light Racket and Terri Barton
3.plot: Elin Palmer and Light Racket combine ethereal pop and Scandinavian sounds. Terri Barton "the Hebrew Hairdresser" gives us some unconventional styling tips.

4.title: DBUK & Brian Justice
4.plot: The Legendary Collective of Slim Cessna, Jay Munly, Lord Dwight Pentacost and Rebecca Vera performs as DBUK. Joined by comedian Brian Justice.

5.title: Ghost Tapes & Christine Lederman
5.plot: Ghost Tapes drops by and astounds with modern soul music that is poetic and cerebral. Comedian Christine Lederman give us the giggles and the television broadcast premiere of Charly Fasano's short film "Feeling Magic" Hosted by Bree Davies.

6.title: Los Retro 45 & Jack Barton
6.plot: Los Retro 45 puts there own melodic twist on nostalgic sounds and comedian Jack Barton brings the house down. Hosted by Bree Davies.

7.title: The Milk Blossoms & David Rodriquez
7.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

8.title: Dead But Fancy & Jodee Champion
8.plot: Dead But Fancy, a spooky, fun and spectacular three piece consisting of Dustin Bones, Skullivia Bones and Count Varwig. Comedian Jodee Champion make us blush. The Television Broadcast Premier of Charly Fasano's short film "The Ringer." Hosted by Bree Davies.

9.title: SIR and Jon Wilkins
9.plot: SIR is a Denver based band of sexy-emotional-rock-pop vibes and a dynamic sound that is unparalleled. The comedy of Jon Wilkins, a regular guy in his Divorties with regular problems. Hosted by the legendary Andrew Novick.

10.title: Eros & the Eschaton & Steven Young
10.plot: Eros and the Eschaton transform our studio into a sonic reverie that is transcendent and definitely a band to keep an eye on. Joined by comedian Stephen Young and hosted by Andrew Novick.

11.title: Jobless & Jon DeCelles
11.plot: Jobless are Jeff, Jackie and Andy. Three Denver natives who like 2 and a half minute pop songs and dessert after dinner. The thought provoking comedy of Jon DeCelles and hosted by Andrew Novick.

12.title: Bison Bones & Rion Evans
12.plot: Bison Bone is a working class cosmic country band from Denver, CO. Roots music coupled with a dark country feel, that give way to a sound blending psychedelic rock and Americana splash. Joined by comic sensation Rion Evans and hosted by Andrew Novick.

13.title: Gun Street Ghost & Zach Reinert
13.plot: Denver Based Americana Outfit, Gun Street Ghost joins us with an incredible performance. One of our favorite comedians, Zach Reinert returns truimphantly. Hosted by the brilliant Bree Davies. Curated by John Baxter, This Ain't No Cown Town and Oil Slick Culture Cast.

14.title: Lawsuit Models & Matt Cobbs
14.plot: Lawsuit Models holds court as a power pop punk band that will move you to your feet. Joined by the hilarious funny man, Matt Cobos, Hosted by Sheroe Bree Davies. Curated by John Baxter, This Ain't No Cown Town and Oil Slick Culture Cast.

15.title: Native Daughters & Bryon F. Graham
15.plot: Native Daughters' sound packs many body blows from heavy, riff-based post-metal. But it also draws melodies and rhythmic tension. Joined by Byron Graham who is a journeyman stand-up, freelance writer and gentleman of leisure. Curated by John Baxter, This Ain't No Cown Town and Oil Slick Culture Cast.

16.title: Echo Beds & Jay Gillespie
16.plot: Denver icons the Echo Beds take the stage in a powerful performance that will leave a lasting impression. Joined by comic Jay Gillespie who hits the stage like a hurricane. Hosted by the power of the half hour, Bree Davies. Curated by John Baxter, This Ain't No Cown Town and Oil Slick Culture Cast.

-1.title: Music Video Special: Part One
-1.plot: The moment we have all been waiting for has arrived. Sounds on 29th is showcasing some of the best local music videos to ever hit the small screen. Part one features: The Milk Blossoms, Itchy-O, Safe Boating is No Accident, Bleak Plaza, Holophrase, Roka Hueka and Bolonium. Hosted by Denver music mainstay Bree Davies.
